name: Elmahrouk Hassen

education.institution: Higher School of Communication of Tunis-Sup'com

education.degree: Preparatory Cycles to Engineering Studies Degree

relevantCoursework: Signals transmission and processing and security

internships.title: Information Technology Intern
description: Collaborated with the IT team to design and implement a robust network architecture within the EVE-NG platform.
Configured and maintained various network devices, including switches, routers, firewalls, and servers, to support the implementation project.
configured the CISCO Identity Services Engine (ISE) to enhance network security and identity management.
Assisted in the development of network policies and access control rules within the CISCO ISE to ensure compliance with security standards.
Worked closely with team members to troubleshoot and resolve network and security-related issues.

internships.title: Development of an AI-based customer assistant chatbot
description: Created a specialized dataset in French by extracting product descriptions from the company's portfolio, providing valuable linguistic resources for the project.
Conducted comprehensive documentation on various Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques, with a focus on Transformer-based models.
Leveraged programming skills in Python and utilized popular libraries such as Hugging Face for NLP model development.
Employed two distinct approaches for chatbot development: intent classification and generative models .

For intent classification, meticulously preprocessed and prepared the French dataset, incorporating techniques such as lemmatization. Subsequently, trained a French version of the BERT model, named Flaubert, to enhance model accuracy in a non-English language context.

Evaluated and fine-tuned generative models, including Vicuna, Ilma, and Falcon, using the QLoRA method to enhance their performance, and selected the most suitable model based on benchmarking results.
Conducted a comparative analysis of the two approaches, ultimately opting for the generative model approach due to its superior adaptability to diverse user queries and requirements.
Implemented the chosen generative model as an API using the FastAPI framework, making the chatbot accessible for real-time interactions and integration with the company's systems.

projects.name: Electricity price forecasting
description: data preparation, cleaning, and visualization for Electricity Price Forecasting.
Engineered features and selected models, enhancing forecast accuracy.
Visualized data to uncover trends and patterns.
Interpreted and communicated results effectively.

projects.name: Smart Glasses for Visual Impaired
description: Integrated the YOLO (You Only Look Once) algorithm into the system to enable real-time object detection, providing users with valuable information about their surroundings.
Led a comprehensive evaluation of depth estimation techniques, comparing stereo vision and deep learning approaches ensuring the selection of the most effective and accurate method.
Implemented the solution on a Raspberry Pi, optimizing it for portability and ease of use, ultimately enabling blind users to receive timely warnings and navigate their environment more confidently.

projects.name: Customer Churn Analysis using PySpark
description: Completed a data analysis project using the IBM Telco customer churn dataset.
Utilized PySpark to perform data transformation, cleaning, and feature engineering.
Developed and implemented machine learning models for predicting customer churn using PySpark MLlib.

projects.name: Image Search Engine Development
description: Successfully designed and developed a comprehensive image search engine supporting two primary search features:
Text-Based Search: Implemented a robust text search feature, enabling users to search for images by entering descriptive text. Integrated Elasticsearch for efficient text-based image retrieval.
Image-Based Search: Designed an intuitive image-based search feature, allowing users to upload an image, and the system returns similar images using advanced image similarity algorithms.
Utilized HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to create a user-friendly frontend interface, providing an exceptional user experience.
Employed Flask as the web framework and the ELK stack (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash) for the backend to handle data storage, indexing, and retrieval, ensuring rapid and accurate search results.

certifications: Scientific Computing with Python by Free Code Camp.
Deep Learning for Natural Language Processing course certificate by Udemy.
Test of English for International Communication (TOEIC) certificate: 960/990.
